A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her training, the girl meets a charming aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an exorbitant price. The girl decides to accept the offer in order to finance the horse and her friends lives. I loved October Sky. The thing I loved most had to be the music. It worked two ways: in the first hour of the film, it gives off a sense of the competition between the kids, and the family tradition and background they shared; then in the second hour, it gives off a sense of separation between the characters.
What other movies have you used soundtrack scores to give off meaning?

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence through the evil schemes of the local agriculture cooperative and the ideological rule enforced by the military-backed government of those days.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the cat, and the cat has to ask a local woman, who loves cats (Karyn Parsons), to help him fight the posse.
